performances.description: Outrageously fast and full of power, this is possibly the best ever
Funky. Oh yeah.
"Dolla and a quarta?!? You cant get much with a dolla and a quarta." Awesome Pigpen Rap with some incredible playing behind him.
20 minutes of good music. Thanks Pigpen.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: good lovin>la bamba>good lovin
Stop everything you're doing and listen to this now. No really, do it. Now.
Good Lovin'->Caution->WhoDoYouLove->Caution->Good Lovin, all after an epic DS->Sugar Mag. Amazing that reaching such heights was typical in this era
So good. Gives me the chills everytime. Solid groove emerges, I'd give my left nut to see this live.
Long and wandering, but it finds a lot of interesting places along the way. Pig also manages to talk about cars and make it sound filthy. Bonus.
Very unique version.  Cool intro and then outro to Samson.
This has one of the most interesting jams I've heard in a good lovin.  Not usually a fan but this one got me good!
Pigpen gives this a lovelight-esque rap
Classic version at epic show

performances.venue: Cotterell Gym - Colgate University Hamilton, NY
performances.description: Intense and quick jamming. Charged Bertha > Good Lovin' to open the legendary trio, 11-4, 11-5,11-6

performances.venue: Evans Field House, Northern Illinois University Dekalb, Il
performances.description: Of course these can't compare to the early Good Lovin's, but this is a hot version in a HOT show...
Phil and Pigpen interplay like few others I know.  Brilliant and clear, with a thumping good vibe.
Bertha-> Good lovin', folks at red rocks got a treat
Good Lovin into a wicked Playin in the Band
Follows a super-tight Bertha.  Underrated and deserves a listen
"I can sniff you out, like a trackin' hound...", huge jam with breath-taking moments and China Cat in between, absolutely gorgeous....
Crowd eruption, an encore to close possibly the best 2nd set of the 80's, powerful and addictive at the beginning, the closing bridge goes on forever
Blissful dancealong. As clear a statement of what the good times feeling of the later Donna era could sound like. Nice times.
Jerry proving he's a rock god.  Check out the solos... the Wolf is blazing in this "Bertha>Good Lovin'."

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY

performances.description: Smokin' version

performances.venue: Horton Field House - Illinois State University Normal, IL
performances.description: Full of Energy, Jerry is ripping!

performances.venue: McArthur Court, U of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: Out of a great bertha

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Beast mode Good Lovin' here!
Smoked out of Bertha...the combo was nailed this evening.
I know its tough to differentiate 77/78 versions, but this whole show has that little extra even for 77.  As good as any from 77/78.
energy to spare. 20 min. of Pig.
short but incredibly sweet.
All round great version...right amount of rap and jamming

performances.venue: River Bend Music Center Cincinnati, OH
performances.description: Bobby has a great (well, for bobby at least) rap at the end with the band peaking behind him.
That Bob and Jerry both get barnburning warm ups (Bertha then this) pays off throughout this immortal show. Don't just start with the 2nd set!

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York, NY
performances.description: Ah...EPIC
HEADY Rager - Funky Phil Bluesy Jerry and Full Pig - they go into Darkness Darkness at abt 14.30 - great stuff here!

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: warp speed, good times

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: A lot of their early (pre-Donna) stuff can be pretty pitchy, but is super high energy. Also nice drums on this.

performances.venue: William and Mary College Hall Williamsburg, VA
performances.description: Great start to only 2nd set from '78 with a Dew
Super crisp and clean by Jer here.  excellent reading of this song.
I really think this a cool version.  Jazzed out in the middle.  Tight w/o too much wasted rap.
The 6 mins here is sweet...painful mid jam cut.  Will get whole version with DaP10.
Short but sweet, instrumental break is lightning in a bottle.
I like these 10 minute versions that are focused and hard hitting.

performances.venue: Fillmore East (Late Show) New York City, NY
performances.description: Great version with a nice little jam in the middle
Non Stop - Full blown scale ridin' here by Garcia.
Press play. Dance. Repeat
Pimpin' this show hard lately.  This version is HOT!  Great jam out of this one.  '76 just doesn't get the dap it deserves
How is this not on the list already??? GREAT jam. On Fire. Epic. Best version EVER.
VEry nice Europe 72 Version
Final jam in an enormous show. Just killer. Follows the one NRPS set you need to hear. Whatta world.
Sweet version...a fine time for the boys
Excellent 1977 version of this.  Comes out of a nice S>F.  Perfect run here...give all three nights a listen.
The whole GANG is having a blast - you can just hear it and feel it. Great force from Bob, throaty DJ, and on point JG accents. Tight!
Hot version, like the rest of the set. Bobby's vocal are great
Driving, crushing, thunderous!
Many twists and turns taken here - Plenty of Pig, too
Starts out and ends as pure spitfire, but takes the time for a slinky Main Ten in the middle.
Rarely pull DP 35 off the shelf, decided to go straight to Disc 4, the 8-6-71 part and figured why not just give the 8-24 Good Lovin' a LOUD listen
Mind bending version from '74. Last show before their hiatus!

performances.venue: New Haven Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: fun version
WOW They nailed this one! Pigpens "rap" is just perfect

performances.venue: Uni Dome, U of Northern Iowa Cedar Falls, IA
performances.description: Coming out of one hot Bertha the energy just keeps building
Hot throughout. Special night.

performances.venue: Camp Randall Field House Madison, WI
performances.description: A fantastic version from a somewhat rare show.
20 min. Pig rap-fest; Heavy and fast barnburner, thunderous drums, and nimble bass
Strays away from the Good Lovin' theme around 2 1/2 minute mark. Excellent improvisation! Gotta check this one out!!

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Real hot sweet and super jammed out the Miller SNBD is the choice as pig is inaudible on aud and it has 2 cuts. Fantastic bluesy rock from 1972.
Full Pig with rap and they catch a cool groove

performances.venue: Activity Center - University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: Great era for Bob GL's.  This one does not disappoint.
Not sure how this whole show isn't on here yet but another hot song from this epic show. Great Bobby version
GL->N'Orleans->GL...great
A very solid, all-around well-played version.  This definitely needs more love!
Enthralling drum solo followed by Phil going absolutely bugshit for 10 minutes.

performances.venue: Lusk Field House - State University Of New York Cortland, NY
performances.description: Are you in the nookie bidness? Yet again, Pig needs somebody to fix his refrigerator.
Doesn't go into a cool rap, like some '71s, but pretty f-in tight jam and a great mix, with everyone sounding great.
Relaxed (Hawaii, natch) vibe without a Pig rap, but the band sounds just outta sight and Pig is on. Good times here.
Bobby does a radioactive cloud rap as this is when Chernobyl blew in the USSR. "Gonna make us all glow in the dark"
Killer Bob version at this most epic 91 show!
This version is more like early 80's than 77/78, which I prefer.

performances.venue: Moody Coliseum - Southern Methodist University Dallas, TX
performances.description: Phil thunders Jerry rips and then Bob takes a poll on what color the drummers should be

performances.venue: Robertson Gym, UC Santa Barbara Goleta, CA
performances.description: To my ears, Bob's best overall performance here, and the whole band really seems to be feeding off the same special energy

performances.venue: East Hall, Franklin & Marshall College Lancaster, PA
performances.description: 25 minutes with your Zen life coach, Ronald McKernan.
I really like this one.
perfect Pig vocal, big Phil bass, blistering Garcia guitar.

performances.venue: Polo Field Golden Gate Park San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Good Lovin with Jerry Garcia on lead vocals!!! Yes you heard me correctly Jerry on lead Sweet fun version A+
Not sure how we missed this one so far. Should be on the board.
Blistering leads that melt to some swinging grooves.
Why isn't this rager on here yet?! Maybe not as long as some, but full of that early Dead energy that we love so much!
This is the month for GL's
Absolutely smokin'... Jerry is all over it with that aggressive buzzsaw tone

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Arena Oakland, CA
performances.description: bertha>good lovin in 89. epic nye run

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Back from when this wasn't just a toss-off after Drums/Space. High voltage Pig.
Rip, Snort, and Grind!

performances.venue: Kiel Opera House St. Louis, MO
performances.description: Follow the bouncing Phil. St. Stephen makes an appearance at about 4 minutes after drums
Hot version.  "It doesn't matter how many camels u have...got to have lovin"  Epic LMFAO.  Very under-rated show.

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: Ends the second set, so you know BobStar is going to bring the goods loving!
this is such a fun sounding version the whole palladium is having a hell of a good time
Hot burner, with Pig's voice just perfect. He drives everyone to higher and higher vocal heights.
Bruce and Brent on Keys Together, HOT!!! Bruce even gets to sing a verse of Good Lovin. Loads of fun great to hear Bruce w/ Brent killer combo.
Fantastic early version of the blues rock classic.
THis is a wonderful version of primal smoking historic grateful dead. Tremendous stuff

performances.venue: Wallace Wade Stadium, Duke University Durham, NC
performances.description: 22 minutes of pigpen blues goodnes, Jerry rips this a new ones
Aight, we're going to just big up this whole show.  This is delicious eat-me goo.  Damn. May '70 is prime love.  Dig the great recording too.
Great blast of fun the place was rockin check the Miller.

performances.venue: Activity Center. Arizona State U Tempe, AZ
performances.description: “Good god, you got to have love.” Comes after a nice bertha, too

performances.venue: Marin County Veterans Auditorium San Rafael, CA
performances.description: Bob does a nice little tribute to Pigpen in this one.
Just a fun bouncy version. Great Brent rap.
Jerry is blazing out of the drums.
A mammoth of version Good Lovin into Drums Back into Good Lovin!!!!!
No Pig rap or sonic dose of the clap like others from the era, a a glorious slow-boiling jam over 18 minutes well worth the listen.
Insights and meditations on life love and picking up hookers from the great one. See his mind at work, jump on the wagon and ride.
Really good transition from Bertha > GL.  Jerry is on fire!
This is maybe the best Weir version.  Perfectly executed...well jammed and great Bob rap...."Push back, push back the night."  Epic version.

performances.venue: McDonough Arena - Georgetown University Washington, DC
performances.description: This is special stuff, even this AUD is cool to listen to.
Ripping version as are most from 70. First half of the tune is the Mickey and Billy Show. Second half is all screaming Garcia leads... Smokes!
nice good lovin' this is a really really good AUD version
Final installment with La Bamba!

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Jer screamin Dr!! Brent just deliverin' a clinic on the B3, strong 80's medicine right here.
Great version coming out of Attics.  Great Bob rap.
Awesome bass leads from Phil, great drumming from Billy, and classic Pigpen rapping.
Great Betty board, no major highlights but recall for sure that Good Lovin'/Bertha smoke

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: A great 1991 version of this beloved cover!!!!!

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Bob goes for it in the rap and Garcia smiles a bit. A fun latter day version, though it never jams out like mad. Video of it here! https://www.youtube

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Bob channels his inner Pigpen. I dig it.

performances.venue: Cafe au Go-Go New York City, NY
performances.description: High octane Seven > Good Lovin' from a overlooked diamond in the rough.

performances.venue: Cal Expo, Building A Sacramento, CA
performances.description: Nice jam
Bobby’s feelin’ it

performances.venue: Spartan Stadium - San Jose State University San Jose, CA
performances.description: A fun rendition from Brent’s first show. Check it out!
Excellent conclusion to a Wharf Rat > I Need a Miracle > Bertha > Good Lovin'. From Road Trips Vol. 1, No. 1. Finishes with an energetic flourish.

performances.venue: Veterans' Memorial Coliseum New Haven, CT
performances.description: Rhythm Devils on point here...DP 25

performances.venue: School Gymnasium, S.U.N.Y. Stony Brook, NY
performances.description: Halloween Lovin'

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center Arena St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Comes right off a top shelf Scarlet Fire this has some poignant and bright Jerry playing. Really incredible 77 take.
Go To Nassau, of the Weir versions, I always liked it more as a show closer
Nice version, out of an epic Bertha, both of which need more love!

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Center Tampa, FL
performances.description: Part of a one-two-punch opener, paired with a heater of a Bertha. Keith adds great texture to Jerry's solo.
17+ minutes of dancin!

performances.venue: Deer Creek Music Center Noblesville, IN
performances.description: even a blind man can see when the sun is shining, he can feel it
Bertha>GoodLovin' to open the second set...in '93!
This one flat out rocks. Amazing energy from Phil.
Outrageous blazing jam.
Why is this classic and historically important show ignored?  They sound great here.  Enjoy.
Follows the breakout of shakedown street nice funky late 1970's version.
another wonderful showing by pigpen and the boys they just killed it in 1970
Fisrt Good Lovin>La Bamba>GL!
2nd Installment of Gl>La Bamba>GL.  Definately all of these are heady with the added La Bamba.
Grugahalle Essen West Germany with special guest Pete Townshend, check out video of the show on you tube, was broadcast in Europe

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Fun and original sounding bobby version which includes full band introductions.
One of the best GL's for Bob.  Great way to close this epic show.  "Push back the night!"

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Heady version with Jerry vocals. Unheady cut in the sbd. Only 5 minutes circulate. I wonder how long this was live.
The boys light this up at the end of legendary lake placid.
Ahh back in the days when good lovin was a platform for a drum solo

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York City, NY
performances.description: Pig on a ferocious rampage, the band sizzling hot behind him, and all this in the first set.  This show deserves more love.

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI

performances.description: Embryonic Good Lovin', but fascinating thinking of how Good Lovin' transformed over the next two years.
I'm diggin' that kinda spacy jam coming out of Drums.
Excellent high energy version. Bob sings the hell out of it!!!
Awesome Good Lovin' from a historically significant show; day after Altamont.
I know, I know, 1995, but this is a strong, fun version, from a surprisingly strong show.
I typically find the post '72 versions of this song to be a bit of filler, but this one has some nice accents from Keith and some ramp-up ending chaw

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway  San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Jerry on vocals
Kingswood Music Theatre, Maple, Ontario, Canada

performances.venue: Santa Rosa Fairgrounds Santa Rosa, CA
performances.description: Funky Blues
Piping hot delivery, right after Scarlet Fire! Yee-haw! That burgundy-smooth, cinnamon in yer coffee-sweetness of 77 flavor! Mickey thwacking as well
Super-fun + life-affirming closer to a blast of a show!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Featured right after Wharf Rat. BLASTING with power and tempo. The opening is explosive and the tempo doesn't let up. Very strong '79 version. FIRE.
Lovin this song
Holy Smokes!!! From an underappreciated show, it has some great organ parts and Bobby is having a blast. From DP 27

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: This one is hot!!
Ok maybe I’m having a major brain fart but I can’t remember Brent ever doing a full blown verse
Closes a fantastic post-drums-space sequence. Just an all-around good one that benefits from the incredible momentum beforehand.

performances.venue: St. Louis Arena St. Louis, MO
performances.description: High energy out of Bertha, great combo to start the show!
That's how you open a set and start the party. Bobby's in full command, Donna tight behind him, Keith blazes like a sparkling meteor. Hot stuff
Pigpen raps about the 'state of our nation', Phil on fire, Darkness jam, just amazing.
Jerry goes on absolute attack mode here. Bill as the only drummer allows for so much space, really great rhythmic moments and a great pigpen rap.

performances.venue: The Palestra, U. of Rochester Rochester, NY

performances.description: BEST LATE 70s Good Lovin!!!  Post Egypt shows, coming out of Bertha, Jerry goes off around 2:20, you can just feel the energy and see his smile....

performances.venue: University of Iowa Iowa City, IA
performances.description: Some rough spots coming back in, but a very interesting almost Santana-esque first jam and a great Pig groove. Interesting one.
My first tape.  I used to listen this GL over and over again doing my newspaper route.  Still my favorite Bob version all time.
One of the group's best executed versions of the "New" Good Lovin'
Nice post pigpen version with tons of added energy from Bruce on Grand Piano
Hot Bertha-> Good Lovin for a stop nuclear power benefit.
Another heady version from the run where Miles Davis quintet opened for the boys.
This is fantastic Pigpen in full display of his powers Just mesmerizing with an awesome assisst from Bobby
Nice ending to set 1.The mid song jam is spell binding melts into deep space.

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Fast almost punk style. Under 5 min but they still jam. Always cool when Jerry sings lead.
Classic Bobby rapping
Bobby's feeling this one
All about the jam.  One of the mello raps of the era, and they go off in that way that says "let's do this forever".  Why not here?
Great year for this tune.  Once again great 82 Bob vocals.
Heyyyyy hey baby to start. Brent nailing his organ, bobby rapping and ya "GOTTA HAVE LOVIN" BIG MISS ON THIS ONE!!!!!!!!
Columbia University
Wow- excellent energy. Great version.
Bob's rap starts off with an indirect mention of Pigpen.
Pretty hot
Wild late version, with Bobby really going for it on the ending vocals. I love this fucking show so much.
Lovin’ these ‘69 Good Lovin’s
Comes charging so perfectly out of "Bertha." Fun version from a GREAT show.
Another punchy shot in the arm from 1970

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY

performances.description: Killer Bob version.
Blaster version – sleepwalker-ish jam at 6 min.
Here's how great this one is: I had to listen to it twice and I still can't figure out what makes it great. But it is.
Always fun
Wow! This one builds mightily. With a brand new Touch of Grey (1st ever!) encore to follow!

performances.venue: Family Dog at the Great Highway San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Billy and Mickey cut loose, then Phil takes over..
Definitely my pick for one of the better Bobby takes on Lovin. Great energy and the band is just locked in perfectly. Laid back and just fun!
A nice contrast to all the ballads from this show.
Joyful
Got to have lovin'
hands up this one's a watery rager
The TC and Pig was a magical time. This GL is terrific w. a very heady drums sequence. All the Pig traits are here: passion, humor, love & the BLUES.

performances.venue: Field House - Seneca College Toronto, ON
performances.description: Can’t believe I get to add this one!  The energy is high, and crazy crazy playing from Jerry

performances.venue: Campus Stadium - University Of California Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Hot Good Lovin with the band all over it, Phil thundering away. SBD sounds extremely good, typical hot Bertha>Good Lovin show opener

performances.venue: Louisiana State U Baton Rouge, LA
performances.description: I can't believe this one isn't here. Short but very sweet.

performances.venue: Pine Knob Music Theater Clarkston, MI
performances.description: Bobby making sure this show doesn't get lost in the shuffle. Great ad-libs, and the full howling range we love.
Hey, this isn't bad! Tacked on to the second set opener Bertha.
Absolutely relentless!!! Listen to this incredible show but poorly sourced show!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York City, NY
performances.description: Brent’s organ takes this to another level. I’m partial towards the Pigpen Version, but this shines in its own ways. Lovely phrasing from Jerry as well
Country fried funk that'll leak your hips sore from how much you're going to be moving them. Steady train ride.
Kicks off one of the great 2nd sets of all time - surprised it isn't here. Donna and Jerry belting out the backing vocals is special.
Start here! This stand alone Lovin' kicks off a legendary second set. Really unique and cool Bobby and Donna vamps on the outro too!

performances.venue: Thompson Arena - Dartmouth College Hanover, NH
performances.description: smokin
Ten minutes... for the better
